    82‚Üí    if (data.length === 0 || data[0] !== 0xF0) {
    83‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid SysEx message: missing start byte');
    84‚Üí    }
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí    // Then check end byte
    87‚Üí    if (data[data.length - 1] !== 0xF7) {
    88‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid SysEx message: missing end byte');
    89‚Üí    }
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí    // Finally check minimum length
    92‚Üí    if (data.length < 5) {
    93‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid SysEx message: too short');
    94‚Üí    }
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí    // Remove start and end bytes
    97‚Üí    const content = data.slice(1, -1);
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí    // Check for universal device inquiry response
   100‚Üí    if (content[0] === 0x7E && content[2] === 0x06) {
   101‚Üí      return this.parseDeviceInquiryResponse(content);
   102‚Üí    }
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí    // Check for Novation manufacturer ID
   105‚Üí    if (content[0] === MANUFACTURER_ID[0] &&
   106‚Üí        content[1] === MANUFACTURER_ID[1] &&
   107‚Üí        content[2] === MANUFACTURER_ID[2]) {
   108‚Üí      return this.parseNovationMessage(content);
   109‚Üí    }
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí    throw new Error('Unknown SysEx message format');
   112‚Üí  }
   113‚Üí
   114‚Üí  /**
   115‚Üí   * Parse universal device inquiry response
   116‚Üí   */
   117‚Üí  private static parseDeviceInquiryResponse(data: number[]): DeviceInquiryResponse {
   118‚Üí    // Format: 7E <device ID> 06 02 <manufacturer ID> <family> <member> <version>
   119‚Üí    if (data.length < 15) {
   120‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid device inquiry response');
   121‚Üí    }
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí    return {
   124‚Üí      type: 'device_inquiry_response',
   125‚Üí      manufacturerId: [data[4] ?? 0, data[5] ?? 0, data[6] ?? 0],
   126‚Üí      familyCode: ((data[7] ?? 0) << 8) | (data[8] ?? 0),
   127‚Üí      familyMember: ((data[9] ?? 0) << 8) | (data[10] ?? 0),
   128‚Üí      softwareRevision: [data[11] ?? 0, data[12] ?? 0, data[13] ?? 0, data[14] ?? 0],
   129‚Üí      data,
   130‚Üí    };
   131‚Üí  }
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí  /**
   134‚Üí   * Parse Novation-specific message
   135‚Üí   */
   136‚Üí  private static parseNovationMessage(data: number[]): SysExMessage {
   137‚Üí    // Skip manufacturer ID (first 3 bytes: 00 20 29)
   138‚Üí    const messageData = data.slice(3);
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí    if (messageData.length < 2) {
   141‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid Novation SysEx message');
   142‚Üí    }
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí    // Check for Launch Control XL 3 format: 02 15 05 00 [operation] [slot]
   145‚Üí    if (messageData.length >= 7 &&
   146‚Üí        messageData[0] === 0x02 &&  // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   147‚Üí        messageData[1] === 0x15 &&  // Command (Custom mode)
   148‚Üí        messageData[2] === 0x05 &&  // Sub-command
   149‚Üí        messageData[3] === 0x00) {  // Reserved
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí      const operation = messageData[4];
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí      // Check if this is a custom mode response (operation 0x10)
   154‚Üí      if (operation === 0x10) {
   155‚Üí        return this.parseCustomModeResponseXL3(messageData); // Pass message data (F0/F7 and manufacturer ID stripped)
   156‚Üí      }
   157‚Üí    }
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí    // Fallback to legacy format parsing
   160‚Üí    const messageType = messageData[1];
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí    switch (messageType) {
   163‚Üí      case SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE:
   164‚Üí        return this.parseTemplateChange(messageData);
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí      case SysExMessageType.CUSTOM_MODE_RESPONSE:
   167‚Üí        return this.parseCustomModeResponse(data);
   168‚Üí
   169‚Üí      default:
   170‚Üí        return {
   171‚Üí          type: 'unknown',
   172‚Üí          manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   173‚Üí          data: messageData,
   174‚Üí        };
   175‚Üí    }
   176‚Üí  }
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí  /**
   179‚Üí   * Parse template change message
   180‚Üí   */
   181‚Üí  private static parseTemplateChange(data: number[]): TemplateChangeMessage {
   182‚Üí    if (data.length < 3) {
   183‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid template change message');
   184‚Üí    }
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí    return {
   187‚Üí      type: 'template_change',
   188‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   189‚Üí      templateNumber: data[2] ?? 0,
   190‚Üí      data,
   191‚Üí    };
   192‚Üí  }
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí  /**
   195‚Üí   * Parse Launch Control XL 3 custom mode response (expects messageData without F0/F7 and manufacturer ID)
   196‚Üí   */
   197‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeResponseXL3(data: number[]): CustomModeMessage {
   198‚Üí    if (data.length < 6) {
   199‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid Launch Control XL 3 custom mode response');
   200‚Üí    }
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí    // Expected format after F0/F7 and manufacturer ID stripped by parseNovationMessage:
   203‚Üí    // 02 15 05 00 10 [SLOT] [419 bytes of data]
   204‚Üí    // Positions: 0  1  2  3  4     5
   205‚Üí    const operation = data[4];
   206‚Üí    const slot = data[5] ?? 0;
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí    if (operation !== 0x10) {
   209‚Üí      throw new Error(`Unexpected operation in Launch Control XL 3 response: 0x${(operation ?? 0).toString(16)}`);
   210‚Üí    }
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí    // Parse the actual custom mode data (starts after slot byte at position 6)
   213‚Üí    const rawModeData = data.slice(6);
   214‚Üí    const { controls, colors, name } = this.parseCustomModeData(rawModeData);
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí    const message: CustomModeMessage = {
   217‚Üí      type: 'custom_mode_response',
   218‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   219‚Üí      slot,
   220‚Üí      controls,
   221‚Üí      colors,
   222‚Üí      data,
   223‚Üí    };
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí    if (name !== undefined) {
   226‚Üí      message.name = name;
   227‚Üí    }
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí    return message;
   230‚Üí  }
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí  /**
   233‚Üí   * Parse legacy custom mode response (for older devices)
   234‚Üí   */
   235‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeResponse(data: number[]): CustomModeMessage {
   236‚Üí    if (data.length < 4) {
   237‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid custom mode response');
   238‚Üí    }
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí    const slot = data[2];
   241‚Üí    if (slot === undefined) {
   242‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid slot in custom mode response');
   243‚Üí    }
   244‚Üí    const encodedData = data.slice(3);
   245‚Üí
   246‚Üí    // Decode the Midimunge-encoded custom mode data
   247‚Üí    const decodedData = Midimunge.decode(encodedData);
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí    // Parse the decoded data into control and color mappings
   250‚Üí    const { controls, colors } = this.parseCustomModeData(decodedData);
   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí    return {
   253‚Üí      type: 'custom_mode_response',
   254‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   255‚Üí      slot,
   256‚Üí      controls,
   257‚Üí      colors,
   258‚Üí      data,
   259‚Üí    };
   260‚Üí  }
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí  /**
   263‚Üí   * Parse custom mode data from raw bytes
   264‚Üí   * Updated to handle Launch Control XL 3 format (not Midimunge)
   265‚Üí   * Note: Device uses 0x48 in READ responses, 0x49 in WRITE commands
   266‚Üí   */
   267‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeData(data: number[]): {
   268‚Üí    controls: ControlMapping[];
   269‚Üí    colors: ColorMapping[];
   270‚Üí    name?: string;
   271‚Üí  } {
   272‚Üí    const controls: ControlMapping[] = [];
   273‚Üí    const colors: ColorMapping[] = [];
   274‚Üí    let modeName: string | undefined;
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí    // Parse mode name - look for ASCII after header pattern
   277‚Üí    let nameStart = -1;
   278‚Üí    let nameEnd = -1;
   279‚Üí
   280‚Üí    // Look for the 0x06 0x20 0x08 or 0x00 0x20 0x08 header pattern first
   281‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < data.length - 3; i++) {
   282‚Üí      if ((data[i] === 0x06 || data[i] === 0x00) && data[i + 1] === 0x20 && data[i + 2] === 0x08) {
   283‚Üí        nameStart = i + 3;
   284‚Üí        break;
   285‚Üí      }
   286‚Üí    }
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí    if (nameStart > 0) {
   289‚Üí      const nameBytes = [];
   290‚Üí      for (let i = nameStart; i < data.length - 2; i++) {
   291‚Üí        const byte = data[i];
   292‚Üí        const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   293‚Üí        const thirdByte = data[i + 2];
   294‚Üí
   295‚Üí        // Stop at specific pattern: 0x49 0x21 0x00 (write response control section start)
   296‚Üí        if (byte === 0x49 && nextByte === 0x21 && thirdByte === 0x00) {
   297‚Üí          nameEnd = i;
   298‚Üí          break;
   299‚Üí        }
   300‚Üí
   301‚Üí        // Stop when we encounter non-printable ASCII
   302‚Üí        if (byte === undefined || byte < 32 || byte > 126) {
   303‚Üí          nameEnd = i;
   304‚Üí          break;
   305‚Üí        }
   306‚Üí
   307‚Üí        // Stop at control markers (0x48 or 0x49) that look like valid control structures
   308‚Üí        if ((byte === 0x48 || byte === 0x49) && i >= nameStart + 1) {
   309‚Üí          // Validate this is actually a control marker by checking next few bytes
   310‚Üí          const defType = data[i + 2];
   311‚Üí          if (nextByte !== undefined && defType === 0x02 && nextByte >= 0x20 && nextByte <= 0x7F) {
   312‚Üí            nameEnd = i;
   313‚Üí            break;
   314‚Üí          }
   315‚Üí        }
   316‚Üí
   317‚Üí        // Add printable ASCII to name
   318‚Üí        nameBytes.push(byte);
   319‚Üí
   320‚Üí        // Safety limit: mode names shouldn't exceed 16 characters
   321‚Üí        if (nameBytes.length >= 16) {
   322‚Üí          nameEnd = i + 1;
   323‚Üí          break;
   324‚Üí        }
   325‚Üí      }
   326‚Üí
   327‚Üí      if (nameBytes.length > 0) {
   328‚Üí        modeName = String.fromCharCode(...nameBytes).trim();
   329‚Üí      }
   330‚Üí    }
   331‚Üí
   332‚Üí    // Parse control definitions
   333‚Üí    // In READ responses: 0x48 [ID] 0x02 [TYPE] [CH] 0x01 0x48 [MIN] [CC] [MAX]
   334‚Üí    // In WRITE responses: different format with 0x40 markers
   335‚Üí
   336‚Üí    // Find where controls actually start (after name)
   337‚Üí    let controlsStart = nameEnd > 0 ? nameEnd : 0;
   338‚Üí    let controlNamesStart = -1;
   339‚Üí
   340‚Üí    // Handle response format after WRITE operation
   341‚Üí    // Look for pattern: 0x49 0x21 0x00 followed by 0x40 control data
   342‚Üí    let writeResponseStart = -1;
   343‚Üí    for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 2; i++) {
   344‚Üí      if (data[i] === 0x49 && data[i + 1] === 0x21 && data[i + 2] === 0x00) {
   345‚Üí        writeResponseStart = i + 3;
   346‚Üí        break;
   347‚Üí      }
   348‚Üí    }
   349‚Üí
   350‚Üí    if (writeResponseStart > 0) {
   351‚Üí      // Parse write response format: series of 0x40 [cc_number] pairs
   352‚Üí      // The control IDs are inferred from the sequence position
   353‚Üí      let controlIndex = 0;
   354‚Üí      const expectedControls = [
   355‚Üí        // Top row encoders (0x10-0x17)
   356‚Üí        0x10, 0x11, 0x12, 0x13, 0x14, 0x15, 0x16, 0x17,
   357‚Üí        // Middle row encoders (0x18-0x1F)
   358‚Üí        0x18, 0x19, 0x1A, 0x1B, 0x1C, 0x1D, 0x1E, 0x1F,
   359‚Üí        // Bottom row encoders (0x20-0x27)
   360‚Üí        0x20, 0x21, 0x22, 0x23, 0x24, 0x25, 0x26, 0x27
   361‚Üí      ];
   362‚Üí
   363‚Üí      for (let i = writeResponseStart; i < data.length - 1; i += 2) {
   364‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x40) {
   365‚Üí          const ccNumber = data[i + 1];
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí          if (ccNumber !== undefined && controlIndex < expectedControls.length) {
   368‚Üí            const controlId = expectedControls[controlIndex];
   369‚Üí
   370‚Üí            if (controlId === undefined) {
   371‚Üí              continue;
   372‚Üí            }
   373‚Üí
   374‚Üí            controls.push({
   375‚Üí              controlId,
   376‚Üí              channel: 0, // Default channel
   377‚Üí              ccNumber,
   378‚Üí              minValue: 0,
   379‚Üí              maxValue: 127,
   380‚Üí              behaviour: 'absolute' as any,
   381‚Üí            });
   382‚Üí
   383‚Üí            // Create color mapping based on control ID
   384‚Üí            let color = 0x3F; // Default
   385‚Üí            if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   386‚Üí              color = 0x60; // Blue for top row encoders
   387‚Üí            } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   388‚Üí              color = 0x48; // Yellow for middle row encoders
   389‚Üí            } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   390‚Üí              color = 0x3C; // Green for bottom row encoders
   391‚Üí            } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   392‚Üí              color = 0x0F; // Red for buttons/other controls
   393‚Üí            } else if (controlId <= 0x07) {
   394‚Üí              color = 0x0F; // Red for faders
   395‚Üí            }
   396‚Üí
   397‚Üí            colors.push({
   398‚Üí              controlId,
   399‚Üí              color,
   400‚Üí              behaviour: 'static', // Default behavior
   401‚Üí            });
   402‚Üí
   403‚Üí            controlIndex++;
   404‚Üí          }
   405‚Üí        } else {
   406‚Üí          // Stop parsing if we don't find expected 0x40 marker
   407‚Üí          break;
   408‚Üí        }
   409‚Üí      }
   410‚Üí    } else {
   411‚Üí      // Fall back to original parsing for READ responses
   412‚Üí      for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 9; i++) {
   413‚Üí        // Handle both 0x48 (read) and 0x49 (write) markers
   414‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x48 || data[i] === 0x49) {
   415‚Üí          if (i + 9 < data.length) {
   416‚Üí            const controlId = data[i + 1];
   417‚Üí            const defType = data[i + 2];
   418‚Üí            const _controlType = data[i + 3];
   419‚Üí            const channel = data[i + 4];
   420‚Üí            const param1 = data[i + 5];
   421‚Üí
   422‚Üí            // Validate it's a control structure (not part of name or other data)
   423‚Üí            const isValidControl = defType === 0x02 &&
   424‚Üí                                  (param1 === 0x01 || param1 === 0x00) &&
   425‚Üí                                  controlId !== undefined && controlId <= 0x3F; // Valid control ID range
   426‚Üí
   427‚Üí            if (isValidControl && controlId !== undefined) {
   428‚Üí              const minValue = data[i + 7];
   429‚Üí              const ccNumber = data[i + 8];
   430‚Üí              const maxValue = data[i + 9];
   431‚Üí
   432‚Üí              // Ensure all required values are defined
   433‚Üí              if (minValue !== undefined && ccNumber !== undefined && maxValue !== undefined &&
   434‚Üí                  channel !== undefined && _controlType !== undefined) {
   435‚Üí                // Determine control behavior
   436‚Üí                let behaviour = 'absolute';
   437‚Üí
   438‚Üí                controls.push({
   439‚Üí                  controlId,
   440‚Üí                  channel,
   441‚Üí                  ccNumber,
   442‚Üí                  minValue,
   443‚Üí                  maxValue,
   444‚Üí                  behaviour: behaviour as any,
   445‚Üí                });
   446‚Üí
   447‚Üí                // Create color mapping based on control ID
   448‚Üí                let color = 0x3F; // Default
   449‚Üí                if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   450‚Üí                  color = 0x60; // Blue for top row encoders
   451‚Üí                } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   452‚Üí                  color = 0x48; // Yellow for middle row encoders
   453‚Üí                } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   454‚Üí                  color = 0x3C; // Green for bottom row encoders
   455‚Üí                } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   456‚Üí                  color = 0x0F; // Red for buttons/other controls
   457‚Üí                } else if (controlId <= 0x07) {
   458‚Üí                  color = 0x0F; // Red for faders
   459‚Üí                }
   460‚Üí
   461‚Üí                colors.push({
   462‚Üí                  controlId,
   463‚Üí                  color,
   464‚Üí                  behaviour: 'static', // Default behavior
   465‚Üí                });
   466‚Üí              }
   467‚Üí
   468‚Üí              // Skip to next potential control (9 bytes processed)
   469‚Üí              i += 9;
   470‚Üí            }
   471‚Üí          }
   472‚Üí        }
   473‚Üí      }
   474‚Üí    }
   475‚Üí
   476‚Üí    // Parse control names - they appear after all control definitions
   477‚Üí    // Look for the control names section which starts with byte patterns like 0x62, 0x68, 0x69
   478‚Üí    if (controls.length > 0) {
   479‚Üí      // Find where control names section starts - usually after last control definition
   480‚Üí      // Look for patterns like 0x62, 0x68, 0x69 followed by ASCII text
   481‚Üí      for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 2; i++) {
   482‚Üí        // Check if we've passed all control definitions and found name markers
   483‚Üí        const byte = data[i];
   484‚Üí        if ((byte === 0x62 || byte === 0x68 || byte === 0x69 || byte === 0x60 || byte === 0x6A || byte === 0x6F) &&
   485‚Üí            data[i + 1] !== undefined && data[i + 1]! >= 0x30) { // Followed by ASCII
   486‚Üí          controlNamesStart = i;
   487‚Üí          break;
   488‚Üí        }
   489‚Üí      }
   490‚Üí
   491‚Üí      if (controlNamesStart >= 0) {
   492‚Üí        // Parse control names
   493‚Üí        const controlNames: Map<number, string> = new Map();
   494‚Üí        let currentControlId = -1;
   495‚Üí        let currentName = '';
   496‚Üí
   497‚Üí        for (let i = controlNamesStart; i < data.length; i++) {
   498‚Üí          const byte = data[i];
   499‚Üí
   500‚Üí          // Check for control ID markers (0x60-0x6F range often used)
   501‚Üí          if (byte !== undefined && byte >= 0x60 && byte <= 0x6F) {
   502‚Üí            // Save previous name if exists
   503‚Üí            if (currentControlId >= 0 && currentName.length > 0) {
   504‚Üí              controlNames.set(currentControlId, currentName.trim());
   505‚Üí            }
   506‚Üí
   507‚Üí            // Map marker to control ID (this mapping may need adjustment)
   508‚Üí            // Based on hex dump: 0x69 = control 0x28-0x2F range, 0x62 = 0x30 range, etc.
   509‚Üí            if (byte === 0x69) {
   510‚Üí              // Next byte after 0x69 is the control index
   511‚Üí              const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   512‚Üí              if (nextByte !== undefined && nextByte >= 0x28 && nextByte <= 0x3F) {
   513‚Üí                currentControlId = nextByte;
   514‚Üí                i++; // Skip the control ID byte
   515‚Üí              }
   516‚Üí            } else if (byte === 0x62 || byte === 0x68 || byte === 0x6A || byte === 0x6F) {
   517‚Üí              // These seem to be followed by control index
   518‚Üí              const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   519‚Üí              if (nextByte !== undefined && nextByte >= 0x30 && nextByte <= 0x3F) {
   520‚Üí                currentControlId = nextByte;
   521‚Üí                i++; // Skip the control ID byte
   522‚Üí              }
   523‚Üí            } else if (byte === 0x60) {
   524‚Üí              // 0x60 followed by control ID
   525‚Üí              const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   526‚Üí              if (nextByte !== undefined && (nextByte >= 0x28 && nextByte <= 0x3F)) {
   527‚Üí                currentControlId = nextByte;
   528‚Üí                i++; // Skip the control ID byte
   529‚Üí              }
   530‚Üí            }
   531‚Üí            currentName = '';
   532‚Üí          } else if (byte !== undefined && byte >= 32 && byte <= 126) {
   533‚Üí            // ASCII printable character - part of name
   534‚Üí            currentName += String.fromCharCode(byte);
   535‚Üí          } else if (currentName.length > 0 && (byte === 0x60 || byte === 0x00 || byte === 0xF7)) {
   536‚Üí            // End of current name
   537‚Üí            if (currentControlId >= 0 && currentName.length > 0) {
   538‚Üí              controlNames.set(currentControlId, currentName.trim());
   539‚Üí              currentName = '';
   540‚Üí            }
   541‚Üí          }
   542‚Üí        }
   543‚Üí
   544‚Üí        // Save last name if exists
   545‚Üí        if (currentControlId >= 0 && currentName.length > 0) {
   546‚Üí          controlNames.set(currentControlId, currentName.trim());
   547‚Üí        }
   548‚Üí
   549‚Üí        // Apply names to controls
   550‚Üí        for (const control of controls) {
   551‚Üí          if (control.controlId !== undefined) {
   552‚Üí            const name = controlNames.get(control.controlId);
   553‚Üí            if (name) {
   554‚Üí              control.name = name;
   555‚Üí            }
   556‚Üí          }
   557‚Üí        }
   558‚Üí      }
   559‚Üí    }
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí    const result: { controls: ControlMapping[]; colors: ColorMapping[]; name?: string } = {
   562‚Üí      controls,
   563‚Üí      colors
   564‚Üí    };
   565‚Üí
   566‚Üí    if (modeName !== undefined) {
   567‚Üí      result.name = modeName;
   568‚Üí    }
   569‚Üí
   570‚Üí    return result;
   571‚Üí  }

   573‚Üí  /**
   574‚Üí   * Build device inquiry request
   575‚Üí   * @deprecated Use the complete handshake sequence with buildNovationSyn()
   576‚Üí   * and buildUniversalDeviceInquiry() instead. This method only performs
   577‚Üí   * partial handshake and uses incorrect device ID.
   578‚Üí   */
   579‚Üí  static buildDeviceQuery(): number[] {
   580‚Üí    return [
   581‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   582‚Üí      0x7E, // Universal non-realtime
   583‚Üí      0x00, // Device ID (broadcast)
   584‚Üí      0x06, // General information
   585‚Üí      0x01, // Identity request
   586‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   587‚Üí    ];
   588‚Üí  }
   589‚Üí
   590‚Üí  /**
   591‚Üí   * Build Novation SYN message for complete handshake sequence
   592‚Üí   *
   593‚Üí   * This is the first message in the 4-message handshake protocol.
   594‚Üí   * The device will respond with a SYN-ACK containing its serial number.
   595‚Üí   *
   596‚Üí   * Message format: F0 00 20 29 00 42 02 F7 (8 bytes)
   597‚Üí   *
   598‚Üí   * @returns {number[]} SysEx message bytes for Novation SYN request
   599‚Üí   */
   600‚Üí  static buildNovationSyn(): number[] {
   601‚Üí    return [
   602‚Üí      0xF0,              // SysEx start
   603‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29,  // Novation manufacturer ID
   604‚Üí      0x00,              // Device model (Launch Control)
   605‚Üí      0x42,              // Command (handshake)
   606‚Üí      0x02,              // Sub-command (SYN)
   607‚Üí      0xF7               // SysEx end
   608‚Üí    ];
   609‚Üí  }
   610‚Üí
   611‚Üí  /**
   612‚Üí   * Build Universal Device Inquiry message with correct device ID
   613‚Üí   *
   614‚Üí   * This is the third message in the 4-message handshake protocol (ACK).
   615‚Üí   * Uses the correct broadcast device ID (0x7F) instead of 0x00.
   616‚Üí   *
   617‚Üí   * Message format: F0 7E 7F 06 01 F7 (6 bytes)
   618‚Üí   *
   619‚Üí   * @returns {number[]} SysEx message bytes for Universal Device Inquiry
   620‚Üí   */
   621‚Üí  static buildUniversalDeviceInquiry(): number[] {
   622‚Üí    return [
   623‚Üí      0xF0,              // SysEx start
   624‚Üí      0x7E,              // Universal Non-Realtime
   625‚Üí      0x7F,              // Device ID (broadcast)
   626‚Üí      0x06,              // Sub-ID 1 (Device Inquiry)
   627‚Üí      0x01,              // Sub-ID 2 (Inquiry Request)
   628‚Üí      0xF7               // SysEx end
   629‚Üí    ];
   630‚Üí  }
   631‚Üí
   632‚Üí  /**
   633‚Üí   * Parse Novation SYN-ACK response and extract serial number
   634‚Üí   *
   635‚Üí   * This parses the second message in the 4-message handshake protocol.
   636‚Üí   * The SYN-ACK response contains the device's serial number.
   637‚Üí   *
   638‚Üí   * Expected format: F0 00 20 29 00 42 02 [SERIAL_NUMBER] F7 (22 bytes)
   639‚Üí   * Serial number is 14 ASCII characters at bytes 7-20.
   640‚Üí   *
   641‚Üí   * @param {number[]} data - Raw SysEx message bytes including F0/F7
   642‚Üí   * @returns {object} Parsing result with validity flag and optional serial number
   643‚Üí   * @returns {boolean} returns.valid - True if message is valid SYN-ACK
   644‚Üí   * @returns {string} [returns.serialNumber] - Device serial number if valid
   645‚Üí   */
   646‚Üí  static parseNovationSynAck(data: number[]): { valid: boolean; serialNumber?: string } {
   647‚Üí    // Validate message length (should be exactly 22 bytes)
   648‚Üí    if (data.length !== 22) {
   649‚Üí      return { valid: false };
   650‚Üí    }
   651‚Üí
   652‚Üí    // Validate SysEx start and end bytes
   653‚Üí    if (data[0] !== 0xF0 || data[data.length - 1] !== 0xF7) {
   654‚Üí      return { valid: false };
   655‚Üí    }
   656‚Üí
   657‚Üí    // Verify Novation manufacturer ID (bytes 1-3)
   658‚Üí    if (data[1] !== 0x00 || data[2] !== 0x20 || data[3] !== 0x29) {
   659‚Üí      return { valid: false };
   660‚Üí    }
   661‚Üí
   662‚Üí    // Verify command bytes (bytes 4-6)
   663‚Üí    if (data[4] !== 0x00 || data[5] !== 0x42 || data[6] !== 0x02) {
   664‚Üí      return { valid: false };
   665‚Üí    }
   666‚Üí
   667‚Üí    // Extract serial number (bytes 7-20, 14 characters)
   668‚Üí    const serialBytes = data.slice(7, 21);
   669‚Üí
   670‚Üí    // Validate that all serial bytes are printable ASCII
   671‚Üí    for (const byte of serialBytes) {
   672‚Üí      if (byte < 32 || byte > 126) {
   673‚Üí        return { valid: false };
   674‚Üí      }
   675‚Üí    }
   676‚Üí
   677‚Üí    const serialNumber = String.fromCharCode(...serialBytes);
   678‚Üí
   679‚Üí    // Basic validation of Launch Control XL3 serial number format
   680‚Üí    // Should start with "LX2" followed by digits
   681‚Üí    if (!serialNumber.startsWith('LX2') || serialNumber.length !== 14) {
   682‚Üí      return { valid: false };
   683‚Üí    }
   684‚Üí
   685‚Üí    return { valid: true, serialNumber };
   686‚Üí  }
   687‚Üí
   688‚Üí  /**
   689‚Üí   * Build template change message
   690‚Üí   */
   691‚Üí  static buildTemplateChange(templateNumber: number): number[] {
   692‚Üí    if (templateNumber < 0 || templateNumber > 15) {
   693‚Üí      throw new Error('Template number must be 0-15');
   694‚Üí    }
   695‚Üí
   696‚Üí    return [
   697‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
   698‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
   699‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID (Launch Control XL)
   700‚Üí      SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE,
   701‚Üí      templateNumber,
   702‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
   703‚Üí    ];
   704‚Üí  }
   705‚Üí
   706‚Üí  /**
   707‚Üí   * Build custom mode read request
   708‚Üí   */
   709‚Üí  static buildCustomModeReadRequest(slot: number): number[] {
   710‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   711‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   712‚Üí    }
   713‚Üí
   714‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on working MIDI capture from web editor
   715‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 40 [SLOT] 00 F7
   716‚Üí    return [
   717‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   718‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   719‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   720‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   721‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   722‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   723‚Üí      0x40,             // Read operation (CORRECTED from 0x15)
   724‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
   725‚Üí      0x00,             // Parameter (CORRECTED from nothing)
   726‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   727‚Üí    ];
   728‚Üí  }
   729‚Üí
   730‚Üí  /**
   731‚Üí   * Build custom mode write message from CustomMode object
   732‚Üí   */
   733‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteMessage(slot: number, customMode: CustomMode): number[] {
   734‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   735‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   736‚Üí    }
   737‚Üí
   738‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
   739‚Üí
   740‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
   741‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
   742‚Üí
   743‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (max 8 chars)
   744‚Üí    const nameBytes = customMode.name.substring(0, 8);
   745‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < nameBytes.length; i++) {
   746‚Üí      rawData.push(nameBytes.charCodeAt(i));
   747‚Üí    }
   748‚Üí
   749‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID for consistency
   750‚Üí    const sortedControls = Object.values(customMode.controls)
   751‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
   752‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
   753‚Üí
   754‚Üí    // Add control definitions with 0x49 marker and offset
   755‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
   756‚Üí      // Write control structure: 11 bytes
   757‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Write control marker
   758‚Üí      rawData.push((control.controlId ?? 0) + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   759‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Definition type
   760‚Üí      // Convert control type to number if it's a string
   761‚Üí      const controlType = control.controlType ?? control.type ?? 0x00;
   762‚Üí      const controlTypeNum = typeof controlType === 'string' ?
   763‚Üí        (controlType === 'knob' ? 0x05 : controlType === 'fader' ? 0x00 : controlType === 'button' ? 0x09 : 0x00) :
   764‚Üí        controlType;
   765‚Üí      rawData.push(controlTypeNum); // Control type
   766‚Üí      rawData.push(control.midiChannel ?? control.channel ?? 0); // MIDI channel (0-15)
   767‚Üí      rawData.push(0x01); // Parameter 1
   768‚Üí      rawData.push(0x40); // Parameter 2
   769‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Min value (always 0 in write)
   770‚Üí      rawData.push(control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0); // CC number
   771‚Üí      rawData.push(0x7F); // Max value (always 0x7F in write)
   772‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Terminator
   773‚Üí    }
   774‚Üí
   775‚Üí    // Add label data if present
   776‚Üí    if (customMode.labels && customMode.labels.size > 0) {
   777‚Üí      for (const [controlId, label] of customMode.labels) {
   778‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   779‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   780‚Üí        // Add label text
   781‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
   782‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
   783‚Üí        }
   784‚Üí      }
   785‚Üí    } else {
   786‚Üí      // Generate default labels for controls
   787‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
   788‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   789‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
   790‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   791‚Üí        const label = this.generateControlLabel(controlId);
   792‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
   793‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
   794‚Üí        }
   795‚Üí      }
   796‚Üí    }
   797‚Üí
   798‚Üí    // Add color data if present
   799‚Üí    if (customMode.colors && customMode.colors.size > 0) {
   800‚Üí      for (const [controlId, color] of customMode.colors) {
   801‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   802‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   803‚Üí        rawData.push(color); // Color value
   804‚Üí      }
   805‚Üí    } else {
   806‚Üí      // Add default colors (off) for all controls
   807‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
   808‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
   809‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
   810‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
   811‚Üí      }
   812‚Üí    }
   813‚Üí
   814‚Üí    // Build complete message
   815‚Üí    return [
   816‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   817‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   818‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   819‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   820‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   821‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   822‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation
   823‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number
   824‚Üí      ...rawData,       // Custom mode data
   825‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   826‚Üí    ];
   827‚Üí  }
   828‚Üí
   829‚Üí  /**
   830‚Üí   * Build custom mode write request
   831‚Üí   */
   832‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot: number, modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   833‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
   834‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
   835‚Üí    }
   836‚Üí
   837‚Üí    // Validate the custom mode data
   838‚Üí    this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
   839‚Üí
   840‚Üí    // Encode the custom mode data
   841‚Üí    const encodedData = this.encodeCustomModeData(modeData);
   842‚Üí
   843‚Üí    // VERIFIED PROTOCOL: Based on actual web editor traffic capture
   844‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [SLOT] [encoded data] F7
   845‚Üí    // The web editor DOES use 0x45 for write operations with full data payload
   846‚Üí    return [
   847‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
   848‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
   849‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   850‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
   851‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
   852‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
   853‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation with data (confirmed from web editor)
   854‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
   855‚Üí      ...encodedData,   // Encoded custom mode data
   856‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
   857‚Üí    ];
   858‚Üí  }
   859‚Üí
   860‚Üí  /**
   861‚Üí   * Validate custom mode data
   862‚Üí   */
   863‚Üí  static validateCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): void {
   864‚Üí    if (!modeData.controls || !Array.isArray(modeData.controls)) {
   865‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have controls array');
   866‚Üí    }
   867‚Üí
   868‚Üí    if (!modeData.colors || !Array.isArray(modeData.colors)) {
   869‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have colors array');
   870‚Üí    }
   871‚Üí
   872‚Üí    // Validate each control mapping
   873‚Üí    for (const control of modeData.controls) {
   874‚Üí      const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0;
   875‚Üí      if (ccNumber < 0 || ccNumber > 127) {
   876‚Üí        throw new Error('CC number must be 0-127');
   877‚Üí      }
   878‚Üí
   879‚Üí      const channel = control.channel ?? control.midiChannel ?? 0;
   880‚Üí      if (channel < 0 || channel > 15) {
   881‚Üí        throw new Error('Channel must be 0-15');
   882‚Üí      }
   883‚Üí
   884‚Üí      const minValue = control.minValue ?? control.min ?? 0;
   885‚Üí      if (minValue < 0 || minValue > 127) {
   886‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value must be 0-127');
   887‚Üí      }
   888‚Üí
   889‚Üí      const maxValue = control.maxValue ?? control.max ?? 127;
   890‚Üí      if (maxValue < 0 || maxValue > 127) {
   891‚Üí        throw new Error('Max value must be 0-127');
   892‚Üí      }
   893‚Üí
   894‚Üí      if (minValue > maxValue) {
   895‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value cannot be greater than max value');
   896‚Üí      }
   897‚Üí    }
   898‚Üí
   899‚Üí    // Validate each color mapping
   900‚Üí    for (const color of modeData.colors) {
   901‚Üí      if (color.color < 0 || color.color > 127) {
   902‚Üí        throw new Error('Color value must be 0-127');
   903‚Üí      }
   904‚Üí    }
   905‚Üí  }
   906‚Üí
   907‚Üí  /**
   908‚Üí   * Encode custom mode data for Launch Control XL 3 transmission
   909‚Üí   * Based on actual web editor protocol analysis
   910‚Üí   *
   911‚Üí   * IMPORTANT: This creates a complete message with ALL hardware controls,
   912‚Üí   * not just the ones specified in modeData.controls. The device expects
   913‚Üí   * definitions for all possible control IDs.
   914‚Üí   */
   915‚Üí  private static encodeCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
   916‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
   917‚Üí
   918‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
   919‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
   920‚Üí
   921‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (max 8 chars according to protocol)
   922‚Üí    const modeName = modeData.name || 'CUSTOM';
   923‚Üí    const nameToUse = modeName.substring(0, 8);
   924‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < nameToUse.length; i++) {
   925‚Üí      rawData.push(nameToUse.charCodeAt(i));
   926‚Üí    }
   927‚Üí
   928‚Üí    // Create a mapping of provided controls for lookup
   929‚Üí    const controlMap = new Map<number, ControlMapping>();
   930‚Üí    for (const control of modeData.controls) {
   931‚Üí      if (control.controlId !== undefined) {
   932‚Üí        controlMap.set(control.controlId, control);
   933‚Üí      }
   934‚Üí    }
   935‚Üí
   936‚Üí    // Define ALL hardware control IDs that need to be included
   937‚Üí    // Based on Launch Control XL 3 hardware layout
   938‚Üí    const allControlIds = [
   939‚Üí      // Faders (0x00-0x07)
   940‚Üí      0x00, 0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04, 0x05, 0x06, 0x07,
   941‚Üí      // Top row encoders (0x10-0x17)
   942‚Üí      0x10, 0x11, 0x12, 0x13, 0x14, 0x15, 0x16, 0x17,
   943‚Üí      // Middle row encoders (0x18-0x1F)
   944‚Üí      0x18, 0x19, 0x1A, 0x1B, 0x1C, 0x1D, 0x1E, 0x1F,
   945‚Üí      // Bottom row encoders (0x20-0x27)
   946‚Üí      0x20, 0x21, 0x22, 0x23, 0x24, 0x25, 0x26, 0x27,
   947‚Üí      // Side buttons (0x28-0x2F)
   948‚Üí      0x28, 0x29, 0x2A, 0x2B, 0x2C, 0x2D, 0x2E, 0x2F,
   949‚Üí      // Bottom buttons (0x30-0x37)
   950‚Üí      0x30, 0x31, 0x32, 0x33, 0x34, 0x35, 0x36, 0x37
   951‚Üí    ];
   952‚Üí
   953‚Üí    // Add control definitions for ALL hardware controls
   954‚Üí    for (const controlId of allControlIds) {
   955‚Üí      // Get user-defined control or create default
   956‚Üí      const userControl = controlMap.get(controlId);
   957‚Üí      const channel = userControl?.channel ?? userControl?.midiChannel ?? 0;
   958‚Üí      const ccNumber = userControl?.ccNumber ?? userControl?.cc ?? controlId; // Default CC = control ID
   959‚Üí
   960‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Control marker for WRITE
   961‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Add 0x28 offset for controls
   962‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Control definition type
   963‚Üí
   964‚Üí      // Control type based on hardware position
   965‚Üí      let controlType = 0x00;
   966‚Üí      if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   967‚Üí        controlType = 0x05; // Top row encoders

   200‚Üífunction compareCustomModes(sent: CustomMode, received: CustomMode): { matches: boolean; details: string[] } {
   201‚Üí  const details: string[] = [];

   209‚Üí    details.push(`Mode name mismatch: sent="${sent.name}", received="${received.name}"`);
   210‚Üí  }
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí  // Compare control count
   213‚Üí  const sentControlKeys = Object.keys(sent.controls);
   214‚Üí  const receivedControlKeys = Object.keys(received.controls);
   215‚Üí  const controlCountMatch = sentControlKeys.length === receivedControlKeys.length;
   216‚Üí  log.comparison('Control Count', sentControlKeys.length, receivedControlKeys.length, controlCountMatch);
   217‚Üí
   218‚Üí  if (!controlCountMatch) {
   219‚Üí    matches = false;
   220‚Üí    details.push(`Control count mismatch: sent=${sentControlKeys.length}, received=${receivedControlKeys.length}`);
   221‚Üí  }
   222‚Üí
   223‚Üí  // Compare individual controls
   224‚Üí  for (const controlKey of sentControlKeys) {
   225‚Üí    const sentControl = sent.controls[controlKey];
   226‚Üí    const receivedControl = received.controls[controlKey];
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí    if (!receivedControl) {
   229‚Üí      matches = false;
   230‚Üí      details.push(`Missing control in received data: ${controlKey}`);
   231‚Üí      log.error(`Missing control: ${controlKey}`);
   232‚Üí      continue;
   233‚Üí    }
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí    // Compare control properties
   236‚Üí    const controlMatches = compareControlMapping(controlKey, sentControl, receivedControl);
   237‚Üí    if (!controlMatches.matches) {
   238‚Üí      matches = false;
   239‚Üí      details.push(...controlMatches.details);
   240‚Üí    }

   242‚Üí
   243‚Üí  return { matches, details };

    52‚Üí});
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí// Connect to device
    55‚Üíawait controller.connect();
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí// Listen for control changes
    58‚Üícontroller.on('control:change', (controlId, value) => {
    59‚Üí  console.log(`${controlId}: ${value}`);
    60‚Üí});
    61‚Üí
    62‚Üí// Control LEDs
    63‚Üíawait controller.setLed('FOCUS1', 'GREEN_FULL');
    64‚Üíawait controller.flashLed('CONTROL1', 'RED_FULL', 500);
    65‚Üí
    66‚Üí// Load custom mode
    67‚Üíconst mode = await controller.loadCustomMode(0);
    68‚Üíconsole.log(`Loaded mode: ${mode.name}`);
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí// Clean up when done
    71‚Üíawait controller.cleanup();
    72‚Üí\```
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí## üìö Core Concepts
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí### Device Connection
    77‚Üí
    78‚ÜíThe library automatically discovers and connects to the Launch Control XL 3:
    79‚Üí
    80‚Üí\```typescript
    81‚Üíconst controller = new LaunchControlXL3({
    82‚Üí  autoConnect: true,        // Auto-connect on initialization
    83‚Üí  deviceNameFilter: 'Launch Control XL', // Device name filter
    84‚Üí  reconnectOnError: true,   // Auto-reconnect on disconnect
    85‚Üí  maxReconnectAttempts: 5,  // Maximum reconnection attempts
    86‚Üí});
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí// Manual connection
    89‚Üíawait controller.connect();
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí// Check connection status
    92‚Üíif (controller.isConnected()) {
    93‚Üí  const status = controller.getStatus();
    94‚Üí  console.log(`Firmware: ${status.deviceInfo.firmwareVersion}`);
    95‚Üí}
    96‚Üí\```
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí### Control Mapping
    99‚Üí
   100‚ÜíMap hardware controls to MIDI with advanced transformations:
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí\```typescript
   103‚Üí// Simple linear mapping
   104‚Üícontroller.mapControl('FADER1', 0, 7, {
   105‚Üí  min: 0,
   106‚Üí  max: 127,
   107‚Üí  behaviour: 'absolute',
   108‚Üí});
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí// Exponential mapping (perfect for volume)
   111‚Üícontroller.mapControl('FADER2', 0, 11, {
   112‚Üí  min: 0,
   113‚Üí  max: 127,
   114‚Üí  behaviour: 'absolute',
   115‚Üí  transform: {
   116‚Üí    type: 'exponential',
   117‚Üí    curve: 2.5, // Higher = more dramatic curve
   118‚Üí  },
   119‚Üí});
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí// Stepped/quantized values
   122‚Üícontroller.mapControl('SEND_A1', 0, 20, {
   123‚Üí  min: 0,
   124‚Üí  max: 127,
   125‚Üí  behaviour: 'absolute',
   126‚Üí  transform: {
   127‚Üí    type: 'stepped',
   128‚Üí    steps: 8, // Quantize to 8 values
   129‚Üí  },
   130‚Üí});
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üí// Relative encoder modes
   133‚Üícontroller.mapControl('PAN1', 0, 50, {
   134‚Üí  behaviour: 'relative1', // Two's complement
   135‚Üí});
   136‚Üí\```
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí### Value Transformations
   139‚Üí
   140‚ÜíThe library provides 7 value transformation functions:
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí| Transform | Description | Use Case |
   143‚Üí|-----------|-------------|----------|
   144‚Üí| **Linear** | Direct 1:1 mapping (default) | General controls |
   145‚Üí| **Exponential** | Curved response | Volume/filter controls |
   146‚Üí| **Logarithmic** | Inverse exponential curve | Frequency controls |
   147‚Üí| **Stepped** | Quantize to discrete steps | Mode/preset selection |
   148‚Üí| **Toggle** | Binary on/off at threshold | Mute/solo buttons |
   149‚Üí| **Invert** | Reverse the value range | Reverse faders |
   150‚Üí| **Bipolar** | Center at zero (-64 to +63) | Pan controls |
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí### LED Control
   153‚Üí
   154‚ÜíFull control over all 16 button LEDs with colors and effects:
   155‚Üí
   156‚Üí\```typescript
   157‚Üíimport { LED_COLOR_VALUES } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí// Set static color
   160‚Üíawait controller.setLed('FOCUS1', LED_COLOR_VALUES.GREEN_FULL);
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí// Flash effect
   163‚Üíawait controller.flashLed('CONTROL1', LED_COLOR_VALUES.RED_FULL, 500);
   164‚Üí
   165‚Üí// Pulse effect
   166‚Üíawait controller.setLed('FOCUS2', LED_COLOR_VALUES.AMBER_FULL, 'pulse');
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí// Animations
   169‚Üícontroller.startLedAnimation('rainbow', {
   170‚Üí  type: 'rainbow',
   171‚Üí  duration: 5000,
   172‚Üí  controls: ['FOCUS1', 'FOCUS2', 'FOCUS3', 'FOCUS4'],
   173‚Üí  repeat: 'infinite',
   174‚Üí});
   175‚Üí
   176‚Üí// Turn off all LEDs
   177‚Üíawait controller.turnOffAllLeds();
   178‚Üí\```
   179‚Üí
   180‚ÜíAvailable LED colors:
   181‚Üí- **Red**: `RED_LOW`, `RED_MEDIUM`, `RED_FULL`
   182‚Üí- **Amber**: `AMBER_LOW`, `AMBER_MEDIUM`, `AMBER_FULL`
   183‚Üí- **Yellow**: `YELLOW_LOW`, `YELLOW_FULL`
   184‚Üí- **Green**: `GREEN_LOW`, `GREEN_MEDIUM`, `GREEN_FULL`
   185‚Üí- **Off**: `OFF`
   186‚Üí
   187‚ÜíAvailable animations:
   188‚Üí- `rainbow` - Cycle through colors
   189‚Üí- `chase` - Sequential LED chase
   190‚Üí- `pulse` - Synchronized pulsing
   191‚Üí- `flash` - Synchronized flashing
   192‚Üí- `fade` - Fade between colors
   193‚Üí- `custom` - Custom animation callback
   194‚Üí
   195‚Üí### Custom Modes
   196‚Üí
   197‚ÜíManage all 16 device custom modes with full read/write support:
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üí\```typescript
   200‚Üí// Create a new mode
   201‚Üíconst mode = controller.createCustomMode('My DAW Mode');
   202‚Üí
   203‚Üí// Configure controls
   204‚Üímode.controls['FADER1'] = {
   205‚Üí  type: 'fader',
   206‚Üí  channel: 0,
   207‚Üí  cc: 7,
   208‚Üí  min: 0,
   209‚Üí  max: 127,
   210‚Üí  behaviour: 'absolute',
   211‚Üí};
   212‚Üí
   213‚Üí// Configure LEDs
   214‚Üímode.leds['FOCUS1'] = {
   215‚Üí  color: 'GREEN_FULL',
   216‚Üí  behaviour: 'static',
   217‚Üí};
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí// Save to device (slot 0-15)
   220‚Üíawait controller.saveCustomMode(0, mode);
   221‚Üí
   222‚Üí// Load from device
   223‚Üíconst loaded = await controller.loadCustomMode(0);
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí// Export to JSON
   226‚Üíconst json = JSON.stringify(mode);
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí// Import from JSON
   229‚Üíconst imported = JSON.parse(json);
   230‚Üíawait controller.saveCustomMode(1, imported);
   231‚Üí\```
   232‚Üí

   256‚Üí## üìñ API Reference
   257‚Üí
   258‚Üí### Main Class
   259‚Üí
   260‚Üí#### `new LaunchControlXL3(options?)`
   261‚Üí
   262‚ÜíCreates a new controller instance.
   263‚Üí
   264‚Üí**Options:**
   265‚Üí| Option | Type | Default | Description |
   266‚Üí|--------|------|---------|-------------|
   267‚Üí| `midiBackend` | `MidiBackendInterface` | auto-detect | Custom MIDI backend |
   268‚Üí| `autoConnect` | `boolean` | `true` | Auto-connect on init |
   269‚Üí| `enableLedControl` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable LED control |
   270‚Üí| `enableCustomModes` | `boolean` | `true` | Enable custom modes |
   271‚Üí| `enableValueSmoothing` | `boolean` | `false` | Smooth control values |
   272‚Üí| `smoothingFactor` | `number` | `3` | Smoothing amount (1-10) |
   273‚Üí| `deviceNameFilter` | `string` | `'Launch Control XL'` | Device name filter |
   274‚Üí| `reconnectOnError` | `boolean` | `true` | Auto-reconnect |
   275‚Üí| `maxReconnectAttempts` | `number` | `5` | Max reconnect tries |
   276‚Üí
   277‚Üí### Methods
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí#### Device Control
   280‚Üí| Method | Description |
   281‚Üí|--------|-------------|
   282‚Üí| `connect()` | Connect to device (automatically initializes) |
   283‚Üí| `disconnect()` | Disconnect from device |
   284‚Üí| `getStatus()` | Get device status |
   285‚Üí| `isConnected()` | Check connection state |
   286‚Üí| `cleanup()` | Clean up all resources |
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí#### Control Mapping
   289‚Üí| Method | Description |
   290‚Üí|--------|-------------|
   291‚Üí| `mapControl(id, channel, cc, options)` | Map a control |
   292‚Üí| `unmapControl(id)` | Unmap a control |
   293‚Üí| `getControlMapping(id)` | Get control mapping |
   294‚Üí| `updateControlMapping(id, updates)` | Update mapping |
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí#### LED Control
   297‚Üí| Method | Description |
   298‚Üí|--------|-------------|
   299‚Üí| `setLed(id, color, behaviour?)` | Set LED state |
   300‚Üí| `turnOffLed(id)` | Turn off specific LED |
   301‚Üí| `turnOffAllLeds()` | Turn off all LEDs |
   302‚Üí| `flashLed(id, color, duration?)` | Flash LED once |
   303‚Üí| `startLedAnimation(id, animation)` | Start animation |
   304‚Üí| `stopLedAnimation(id)` | Stop animation |
   305‚Üí
   306‚Üí#### Custom Modes
   307‚Üí| Method | Description |
   308‚Üí|--------|-------------|
   309‚Üí| `createCustomMode(name)` | Create new mode |
   310‚Üí| `loadCustomMode(slot)` | Load from device |
   311‚Üí| `saveCustomMode(slot, mode)` | Save to device |
   312‚Üí| `exportCurrentAsCustomMode(name)` | Export current state |
   313‚Üí
   314‚Üí### Events
   315‚Üí
   316‚Üí\```typescript
   317‚Üícontroller.on('device:connected', (device) => { });

   412‚Üí## üåê Browser Support
   413‚Üí
   414‚ÜíAs of v2.0.0, `@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3` supports browser environments using the Web MIDI API!
   415‚Üí
   416‚Üí### Browser Requirements
   417‚Üí
   418‚Üí- Chrome 43+ or Edge 79+ (Chromium-based)
   419‚Üí- Opera 30+
   420‚Üí- HTTPS required (or localhost for development)
   421‚Üí- User permission for MIDI access
   422‚Üí
   423‚Üí**Note**: Safari does not currently support Web MIDI API.
   424‚Üí
   425‚Üí### Browser Usage Example
   426‚Üí
   427‚Üí\```typescript
   428‚Üíimport { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
   429‚Üí
   430‚Üí// Auto-detects Web MIDI API in browser
   431‚Üíconst device = new LaunchControlXL3({
   432‚Üí  enableCustomModes: true
   433‚Üí});
   434‚Üí
   435‚Üí// Request permission and connect
   436‚Üíawait device.connect();
   437‚Üí
   438‚Üí// Use just like in Node.js!
   439‚Üídevice.on('device:connected', () => {
   440‚Üí  console.log('LCXL3 connected!');
   441‚Üí});
   442‚Üí
   443‚Üí// Load custom mode from device
   444‚Üíconst mode = await device.loadCustomMode(0);
   445‚Üíconsole.log('Current mode:', mode);
   446‚Üí\```
   447‚Üí
   448‚Üí### React Example
   449‚Üí
   450‚Üí\```typescript
   451‚Üíimport { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
   452‚Üíimport { LaunchControlXL3 } from '@ol-dsp/launch-control-xl3';
   453‚Üí
   454‚Üífunction useLCXL3Device() {
   455‚Üí  const [device] = useState(() => new LaunchControlXL3({
   456‚Üí    autoConnect: true,
   457‚Üí    enableCustomModes: true
   458‚Üí  }));
   459‚Üí  const [connected, setConnected] = useState(false);
   460‚Üí
   461‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
   462‚Üí    device.on('device:connected', () => setConnected(true));
   463‚Üí    device.on('device:disconnected', () => setConnected(false));
   464‚Üí
   465‚Üí    device.connect().catch(console.error);
   466‚Üí
   467‚Üí    return () => device.cleanup();
   468‚Üí  }, [device]);
   469‚Üí
   470‚Üí  return { device, connected };
   471‚Üí}
   472‚Üí\```
   473‚Üí
   474‚Üí### Troubleshooting Browser Usage
   475‚Üí
   476‚Üí**Permission Denied**
   477‚Üí- Web MIDI requires user permission on first access
   478‚Üí- Must be served over HTTPS (localhost is ok for dev)
   479‚Üí- Some browsers may block in iframes
   480‚Üí
   481‚Üí**Device Not Found**
   482‚Üí- Ensure LCXL3 is connected before initializing
   483‚Üí- Check browser's MIDI permission settings
   484‚Üí- Try refreshing the page after connecting device
   485‚Üí
   486‚Üí**SysEx Not Working**
   487‚Üí- Ensure you're requesting SysEx permission (done automatically)
   488‚Üí- Some browsers may have additional SysEx restrictions
   489‚Üí
   490‚Üí## üêõ Troubleshooting
   491‚Üí
   492‚Üí### Device Not Found
   493‚Üí\```bash
   494‚Üí# Check device is connected
   495‚Üíls /dev/midi*  # Linux
   496‚Üíls /dev/cu.*   # macOS
   497‚Üí
   498‚Üí# Check MIDI permissions
   499‚Üí# macOS: System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy
   500‚Üí# Linux: Add user to audio group
   501‚Üísudo usermod -a -G audio $USER
   502‚Üí\```
   503‚Üí
   504‚Üí### Permission Errors
   505‚Üí\```bash
   506‚Üí# Linux: Add udev rule
   507‚Üíecho 'SUBSYSTEM=="usb", ATTR{idVendor}=="1235", MODE="0666"' | \
   508‚Üí  sudo tee /etc/udev/rules.d/50-launch-control.rules
   509‚Üísudo udevadm control --reload-rules
   510‚Üí\```

   514‚Üí# Try different backends

private static getControlType(control: ControlMapping | undefined, controlId: number): number {
    const controlType = control?.controlType ?? control?.type ?? 'unknown';

    // Determine control type based on hardware layout and control type
    if (controlType === 'encoder' || controlType === 'knob' || controlType === 0x05 || controlType === 0x09 || controlType === 0x0D) {
      // For encoders, determine row based on index/position
      if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
        return 0x05; // Top row encoders (index 0-7)
      } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
        return 0x09; // Middle row encoders (index 8-15)
      } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
        return 0x0D; // Bottom row encoders (index 16-23)
      }
      // Default to top row encoder if controlId doesn't match expected ranges
      return 0x05;
    }

    if (controlType === 'fader' || controlType === 0x00) {
      return 0x00; // Fader
    }

    if (controlType === 'button' || controlType === 0x19 || controlType === 0x25) {
      // For buttons, determine row based on index/position
      if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x2F) {
        return 0x19; // First row buttons (index 0-7)
      } else if (controlId >= 0x30 && controlId <= 0x37) {
        return 0x25; // Second row buttons (index 8-15)
      }
      // Default to first row button
      return 0x19;
    }

    // Fallback: determine by controlId range for backwards compatibility
    if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
      return 0x05; // Top row encoders
    } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
      return 0x09; // Middle row encoders
    } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
      return 0x0D; // Bottom row encoders
    } else if (controlId >= 0x00 && controlId <= 0x07) {
      return 0x00; // Faders
    } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x2F) {
      return 0x19; // First row buttons
    } else if (controlId >= 0x30 && controlId <= 0x37) {
      return 0x25; // Second row buttons
    }

    // Default fallback
    return 0x00;
```

    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí// Custom mode message
    62‚Üíexport interface CustomModeMessage extends SysExMessage {
    63‚Üí  type: 'custom_mode_response' | 'custom_mode_write';
    64‚Üí  slot: number;
    65‚Üí  name?: string;
    66‚Üí  controls: ControlMapping[];
    67‚Üí  colors: ColorMapping[];
    68‚Üí}
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí// Control mapping for custom modes
    71‚Üí// ControlMapping and ColorMapping interfaces are now imported from types/CustomMode.ts
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí/**
    74‚Üí * SysEx message parser and builder
    75‚Üí */
    76‚Üíexport class SysExParser {
    77‚Üí  /**
    78‚Üí   * Parse a SysEx message
    79‚Üí   */
    80‚Üí  static parse(data: number[]): SysExMessage {
    81‚Üí    // Check start byte first
    82‚Üí    if (data.length === 0 || data[0] !== 0xF0) {
    83‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid SysEx message: missing start byte');
    84‚Üí    }
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí    // Then check end byte
    87‚Üí    if (data[data.length - 1] !== 0xF7) {
    88‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid SysEx message: missing end byte');
    89‚Üí    }
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí    // Finally check minimum length
    92‚Üí    if (data.length < 5) {
    93‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid SysEx message: too short');
    94‚Üí    }
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí    // Remove start and end bytes
    97‚Üí    const content = data.slice(1, -1);
    98‚Üí
    99‚Üí    // Check for universal device inquiry response
   100‚Üí    if (content[0] === 0x7E && content[2] === 0x06) {
   101‚Üí      return this.parseDeviceInquiryResponse(content);
   102‚Üí    }
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí    // Check for Novation manufacturer ID
   105‚Üí    if (content[0] === MANUFACTURER_ID[0] &&
   106‚Üí        content[1] === MANUFACTURER_ID[1] &&
   107‚Üí        content[2] === MANUFACTURER_ID[2]) {
   108‚Üí      return this.parseNovationMessage(content);
   109‚Üí    }
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí    throw new Error('Unknown SysEx message format');
   112‚Üí  }
   113‚Üí
   114‚Üí  /**
   115‚Üí   * Parse universal device inquiry response
   116‚Üí   */
   117‚Üí  private static parseDeviceInquiryResponse(data: number[]): DeviceInquiryResponse {
   118‚Üí    // Format: 7E <device ID> 06 02 <manufacturer ID> <family> <member> <version>
   119‚Üí    if (data.length < 15) {
   120‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid device inquiry response');
   121‚Üí    }
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí    return {
   124‚Üí      type: 'device_inquiry_response',
   125‚Üí      manufacturerId: [data[4] ?? 0, data[5] ?? 0, data[6] ?? 0],
   126‚Üí      familyCode: ((data[7] ?? 0) << 8) | (data[8] ?? 0),
   127‚Üí      familyMember: ((data[9] ?? 0) << 8) | (data[10] ?? 0),
   128‚Üí      softwareRevision: [data[11] ?? 0, data[12] ?? 0, data[13] ?? 0, data[14] ?? 0],
   129‚Üí      data,
   130‚Üí    };
   131‚Üí  }
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí  /**
   134‚Üí   * Parse Novation-specific message
   135‚Üí   */
   136‚Üí  private static parseNovationMessage(data: number[]): SysExMessage {
   137‚Üí    // Skip manufacturer ID (first 3 bytes: 00 20 29)
   138‚Üí    const messageData = data.slice(3);
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí    if (messageData.length < 2) {
   141‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid Novation SysEx message');
   142‚Üí    }
   143‚Üí
   144‚Üí    // Check for Launch Control XL 3 format: 02 15 05 00 [operation] [slot]
   145‚Üí    if (messageData.length >= 7 &&
   146‚Üí        messageData[0] === 0x02 &&  // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
   147‚Üí        messageData[1] === 0x15 &&  // Command (Custom mode)
   148‚Üí        messageData[2] === 0x05 &&  // Sub-command
   149‚Üí        messageData[3] === 0x00) {  // Reserved
   150‚Üí
   151‚Üí      const operation = messageData[4];
   152‚Üí
   153‚Üí      // Check if this is a custom mode response (operation 0x10)
   154‚Üí      if (operation === 0x10) {
   155‚Üí        return this.parseCustomModeResponseXL3(messageData); // Pass message data (F0/F7 and manufacturer ID stripped)
   156‚Üí      }
   157‚Üí    }
   158‚Üí
   159‚Üí    // Fallback to legacy format parsing
   160‚Üí    const messageType = messageData[1];
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí    switch (messageType) {
   163‚Üí      case SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE:
   164‚Üí        return this.parseTemplateChange(messageData);
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí      case SysExMessageType.CUSTOM_MODE_RESPONSE:
   167‚Üí        return this.parseCustomModeResponse(data);
   168‚Üí
   169‚Üí      default:
   170‚Üí        return {
   171‚Üí          type: 'unknown',
   172‚Üí          manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   173‚Üí          data: messageData,
   174‚Üí        };
   175‚Üí    }
   176‚Üí  }
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí  /**
   179‚Üí   * Parse template change message
   180‚Üí   */
   181‚Üí  private static parseTemplateChange(data: number[]): TemplateChangeMessage {
   182‚Üí    if (data.length < 3) {
   183‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid template change message');
   184‚Üí    }
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí    return {
   187‚Üí      type: 'template_change',
   188‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   189‚Üí      templateNumber: data[2] ?? 0,
   190‚Üí      data,
   191‚Üí    };
   192‚Üí  }
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí  /**
   195‚Üí   * Parse Launch Control XL 3 custom mode response (expects messageData without F0/F7 and manufacturer ID)
   196‚Üí   */
   197‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeResponseXL3(data: number[]): CustomModeMessage {
   198‚Üí    if (data.length < 6) {
   199‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid Launch Control XL 3 custom mode response');
   200‚Üí    }
   201‚Üí
   202‚Üí    // Expected format after F0/F7 and manufacturer ID stripped by parseNovationMessage:
   203‚Üí    // 02 15 05 00 10 [SLOT] [419 bytes of data]
   204‚Üí    // Positions: 0  1  2  3  4     5
   205‚Üí    const operation = data[4];
   206‚Üí    const slot = data[5] ?? 0;
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üí    if (operation !== 0x10) {
   209‚Üí      throw new Error(`Unexpected operation in Launch Control XL 3 response: 0x${(operation ?? 0).toString(16)}`);
   210‚Üí    }
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí    // Parse the actual custom mode data (starts after slot byte at position 6)
   213‚Üí    const rawModeData = data.slice(6);
   214‚Üí    const { controls, colors, name } = this.parseCustomModeData(rawModeData);
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí    const message: CustomModeMessage = {
   217‚Üí      type: 'custom_mode_response',
   218‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   219‚Üí      slot,
   220‚Üí      controls,
   221‚Üí      colors,
   222‚Üí      data,
   223‚Üí    };
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí    if (name !== undefined) {
   226‚Üí      message.name = name;
   227‚Üí    }
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí    return message;
   230‚Üí  }
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí  /**
   233‚Üí   * Parse legacy custom mode response (for older devices)
   234‚Üí   */
   235‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeResponse(data: number[]): CustomModeMessage {
   236‚Üí    if (data.length < 4) {
   237‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid custom mode response');
   238‚Üí    }
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí    const slot = data[2];
   241‚Üí    if (slot === undefined) {
   242‚Üí      throw new Error('Invalid slot in custom mode response');
   243‚Üí    }
   244‚Üí    const encodedData = data.slice(3);
   245‚Üí
   246‚Üí    // Decode the Midimunge-encoded custom mode data
   247‚Üí    const decodedData = Midimunge.decode(encodedData);
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí    // Parse the decoded data into control and color mappings
   250‚Üí    const { controls, colors } = this.parseCustomModeData(decodedData);
   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí    return {
   253‚Üí      type: 'custom_mode_response',
   254‚Üí      manufacturerId: MANUFACTURER_ID,
   255‚Üí      slot,
   256‚Üí      controls,
   257‚Üí      colors,
   258‚Üí      data,
   259‚Üí    };
   260‚Üí  }
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí  /**
   263‚Üí   * Parse custom mode data from raw bytes
   264‚Üí   * Updated to handle Launch Control XL 3 format (not Midimunge)
   265‚Üí   * Note: Device uses 0x48 in READ responses, 0x49 in WRITE commands
   266‚Üí   */
   267‚Üí  private static parseCustomModeData(data: number[]): {
   268‚Üí    controls: ControlMapping[];
   269‚Üí    colors: ColorMapping[];
   270‚Üí    name?: string;
   271‚Üí  } {
   272‚Üí    const controls: ControlMapping[] = [];
   273‚Üí    const colors: ColorMapping[] = [];
   274‚Üí    let modeName: string | undefined;
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí    // Parse mode name - look for ASCII after header pattern
   277‚Üí    let nameStart = -1;
   278‚Üí    let nameEnd = -1;
   279‚Üí
   280‚Üí    // Look for header patterns (PHASE 2 UPDATE)
   281‚Üí    // Old formats: 0x06 0x20 0x08 or 0x00 0x20 0x08 (3 bytes + name)
   282‚Üí    // New format: 0x01 0x20 0x10 0x2A (4 bytes + name)
   283‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < data.length - 4; i++) {
   284‚Üí      // Check for new format first (4 bytes)
   285‚Üí      if (data[i] === 0x01 && data[i + 1] === 0x20 && data[i + 2] === 0x10 && data[i + 3] === 0x2A) {
   286‚Üí        nameStart = i + 4;
   287‚Üí        break;
   288‚Üí      }
   289‚Üí      // Check for old formats (3 bytes) for backward compatibility
   290‚Üí      if (i < data.length - 3 && (data[i] === 0x06 || data[i] === 0x00) && data[i + 1] === 0x20 && data[i + 2] === 0x08) {
   291‚Üí        nameStart = i + 3;
   292‚Üí        break;
   293‚Üí      }
   294‚Üí    }
   295‚Üí
   296‚Üí    if (nameStart > 0) {
   297‚Üí      const nameBytes = [];
   298‚Üí      for (let i = nameStart; i < data.length - 2; i++) {
   299‚Üí        const byte = data[i];
   300‚Üí        const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   301‚Üí        const thirdByte = data[i + 2];
   302‚Üí
   303‚Üí        // Stop at specific pattern: 0x49 0x21 0x00 (write response control section start)
   304‚Üí        if (byte === 0x49 && nextByte === 0x21 && thirdByte === 0x00) {
   305‚Üí          nameEnd = i;
   306‚Üí          break;
   307‚Üí        }
   308‚Üí
   309‚Üí        // Stop when we encounter non-printable ASCII
   310‚Üí        if (byte === undefined || byte < 32 || byte > 126) {
   311‚Üí          nameEnd = i;
   312‚Üí          break;
   313‚Üí        }
   314‚Üí
   315‚Üí        // Stop at control markers (0x48 or 0x49) that look like valid control structures
   316‚Üí        if ((byte === 0x48 || byte === 0x49) && i >= nameStart + 1) {
   317‚Üí          // Validate this is actually a control marker by checking next few bytes
   318‚Üí          const defType = data[i + 2];
   319‚Üí          if (nextByte !== undefined && defType === 0x02 && nextByte >= 0x20 && nextByte <= 0x7F) {
   320‚Üí            nameEnd = i;
   321‚Üí            break;
   322‚Üí          }
   323‚Üí        }
   324‚Üí
   325‚Üí        // Add printable ASCII to name
   326‚Üí        nameBytes.push(byte);
   327‚Üí
   328‚Üí        // Safety limit: mode names shouldn't exceed 16 characters
   329‚Üí        if (nameBytes.length >= 16) {
   330‚Üí          nameEnd = i + 1;
   331‚Üí          break;
   332‚Üí        }
   333‚Üí      }
   334‚Üí
   335‚Üí      if (nameBytes.length > 0) {
   336‚Üí        modeName = String.fromCharCode(...nameBytes).trim();
   337‚Üí      }
   338‚Üí    }
   339‚Üí
   340‚Üí    // Parse control definitions
   341‚Üí    // In READ responses: 0x48 [ID] 0x02 [TYPE] [CH] 0x01 0x48 [MIN] [CC] [MAX]
   342‚Üí    // In WRITE responses: different format with 0x40 markers
   343‚Üí
   344‚Üí    // Find where controls actually start (after name)
   345‚Üí    let controlsStart = nameEnd > 0 ? nameEnd : 0;
   346‚Üí    let controlNamesStart = -1;
   347‚Üí
   348‚Üí    // Handle response format after WRITE operation
   349‚Üí    // Look for pattern: 0x49 0x21 0x00 followed by 0x40 control data
   350‚Üí    let writeResponseStart = -1;
   351‚Üí    for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 2; i++) {
   352‚Üí      if (data[i] === 0x49 && data[i + 1] === 0x21 && data[i + 2] === 0x00) {
   353‚Üí        writeResponseStart = i + 3;
   354‚Üí        break;
   355‚Üí      }
   356‚Üí    }
   357‚Üí
   358‚Üí    if (writeResponseStart > 0) {
   359‚Üí      // Parse write response format: series of 0x40 [cc_number] pairs
   360‚Üí      // The control IDs are inferred from the sequence position
   361‚Üí      let controlIndex = 0;
   362‚Üí      const expectedControls = [
   363‚Üí        // Top row encoders (0x10-0x17)
   364‚Üí        0x10, 0x11, 0x12, 0x13, 0x14, 0x15, 0x16, 0x17,
   365‚Üí        // Middle row encoders (0x18-0x1F)
   366‚Üí        0x18, 0x19, 0x1A, 0x1B, 0x1C, 0x1D, 0x1E, 0x1F,
   367‚Üí        // Bottom row encoders (0x20-0x27)
   368‚Üí        0x20, 0x21, 0x22, 0x23, 0x24, 0x25, 0x26, 0x27
   369‚Üí      ];
   370‚Üí
   371‚Üí      for (let i = writeResponseStart; i < data.length - 1; i += 2) {
   372‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x40) {
   373‚Üí          const ccNumber = data[i + 1];
   374‚Üí
   375‚Üí          if (ccNumber !== undefined && controlIndex < expectedControls.length) {
   376‚Üí            const controlId = expectedControls[controlIndex];
   377‚Üí
   378‚Üí            if (controlId === undefined) {
   379‚Üí              continue;
   380‚Üí            }
   381‚Üí
   382‚Üí            controls.push({
   383‚Üí              controlId,
   384‚Üí              channel: 0, // Default channel
   385‚Üí              ccNumber,
   386‚Üí              minValue: 0,
   387‚Üí              maxValue: 127,
   388‚Üí              behaviour: 'absolute' as any,
   389‚Üí            });
   390‚Üí
   391‚Üí            // Create color mapping based on control ID
   392‚Üí            let color = 0x3F; // Default
   393‚Üí            if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   394‚Üí              color = 0x60; // Blue for top row encoders
   395‚Üí            } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   396‚Üí              color = 0x48; // Yellow for middle row encoders
   397‚Üí            } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   398‚Üí              color = 0x3C; // Green for bottom row encoders
   399‚Üí            } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   400‚Üí              color = 0x0F; // Red for buttons/other controls
   401‚Üí            } else if (controlId <= 0x07) {
   402‚Üí              color = 0x0F; // Red for faders
   403‚Üí            }
   404‚Üí
   405‚Üí            colors.push({
   406‚Üí              controlId,
   407‚Üí              color,
   408‚Üí              behaviour: 'static', // Default behavior
   409‚Üí            });
   410‚Üí
   411‚Üí            controlIndex++;
   412‚Üí          }
   413‚Üí        } else {
   414‚Üí          // Stop parsing if we don't find expected 0x40 marker
   415‚Üí          break;
   416‚Üí        }
   417‚Üí      }
   418‚Üí    } else {
   419‚Üí      // Fall back to original parsing for READ responses
   420‚Üí      for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 9; i++) {
   421‚Üí        // Handle both 0x48 (read) and 0x49 (write) markers
   422‚Üí        if (data[i] === 0x48 || data[i] === 0x49) {
   423‚Üí          if (i + 9 < data.length) {
   424‚Üí            const controlId = data[i + 1];
   425‚Üí            const defType = data[i + 2];
   426‚Üí            const _controlType = data[i + 3];
   427‚Üí            const channel = data[i + 4];
   428‚Üí            const param1 = data[i + 5];
   429‚Üí
   430‚Üí            // Validate it's a control structure (not part of name or other data)
   431‚Üí            const isValidControl = defType === 0x02 &&
   432‚Üí                                  (param1 === 0x01 || param1 === 0x00) &&
   433‚Üí                                  controlId !== undefined && controlId <= 0x3F; // Valid control ID range
   434‚Üí
   435‚Üí            if (isValidControl && controlId !== undefined) {
   436‚Üí              const minValue = data[i + 7];
   437‚Üí              const ccNumber = data[i + 8];
   438‚Üí              const maxValue = data[i + 9];
   439‚Üí
   440‚Üí              // Ensure all required values are defined
   441‚Üí              if (minValue !== undefined && ccNumber !== undefined && maxValue !== undefined &&
   442‚Üí                  channel !== undefined && _controlType !== undefined) {
   443‚Üí                // Determine control behavior
   444‚Üí                let behaviour = 'absolute';
   445‚Üí
   446‚Üí                controls.push({
   447‚Üí                  controlId,
   448‚Üí                  channel,
   449‚Üí                  ccNumber,
   450‚Üí                  minValue,
   451‚Üí                  maxValue,
   452‚Üí                  behaviour: behaviour as any,
   453‚Üí                });
   454‚Üí
   455‚Üí                // Create color mapping based on control ID
   456‚Üí                let color = 0x3F; // Default
   457‚Üí                if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
   458‚Üí                  color = 0x60; // Blue for top row encoders
   459‚Üí                } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
   460‚Üí                  color = 0x48; // Yellow for middle row encoders
   461‚Üí                } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
   462‚Üí                  color = 0x3C; // Green for bottom row encoders
   463‚Üí                } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
   464‚Üí                  color = 0x0F; // Red for buttons/other controls
   465‚Üí                } else if (controlId <= 0x07) {
   466‚Üí                  color = 0x0F; // Red for faders
   467‚Üí                }
   468‚Üí
   469‚Üí                colors.push({
   470‚Üí                  controlId,
   471‚Üí                  color,
   472‚Üí                  behaviour: 'static', // Default behavior
   473‚Üí                });
   474‚Üí              }
   475‚Üí
   476‚Üí              // Skip to next potential control (9 bytes processed)
   477‚Üí              i += 9;
   478‚Üí            }
   479‚Üí          }
   480‚Üí        }
   481‚Üí      }
   482‚Üí    }
   483‚Üí
   484‚Üí    // Parse control names - they appear after all control definitions
   485‚Üí    // Look for the control names section which starts with byte patterns like 0x62, 0x68, 0x69
   486‚Üí    if (controls.length > 0) {
   487‚Üí      // Find where control names section starts - usually after last control definition
   488‚Üí      // Look for patterns like 0x62, 0x68, 0x69 followed by ASCII text
   489‚Üí      for (let i = controlsStart; i < data.length - 2; i++) {
   490‚Üí        // Check if we've passed all control definitions and found name markers
   491‚Üí        const byte = data[i];
   492‚Üí        if ((byte === 0x62 || byte === 0x68 || byte === 0x69 || byte === 0x60 || byte === 0x6A || byte === 0x6F) &&
   493‚Üí            data[i + 1] !== undefined && data[i + 1]! >= 0x30) { // Followed by ASCII
   494‚Üí          controlNamesStart = i;
   495‚Üí          break;
   496‚Üí        }
   497‚Üí      }
   498‚Üí
   499‚Üí      if (controlNamesStart >= 0) {
   500‚Üí        // Parse control names
   501‚Üí        const controlNames: Map<number, string> = new Map();
   502‚Üí        let currentControlId = -1;
   503‚Üí        let currentName = '';
   504‚Üí
   505‚Üí        for (let i = controlNamesStart; i < data.length; i++) {
   506‚Üí          const byte = data[i];
   507‚Üí
   508‚Üí          // Check for control ID markers (0x60-0x6F range often used)
   509‚Üí          if (byte !== undefined && byte >= 0x60 && byte <= 0x6F) {
   510‚Üí            // Save previous name if exists
   511‚Üí            if (currentControlId >= 0 && currentName.length > 0) {
   512‚Üí              controlNames.set(currentControlId, currentName.trim());
   513‚Üí            }
   514‚Üí
   515‚Üí            // Map marker to control ID (this mapping may need adjustment)
   516‚Üí            // Based on hex dump: 0x69 = control 0x28-0x2F range, 0x62 = 0x30 range, etc.
   517‚Üí            if (byte === 0x69) {
   518‚Üí              // Next byte after 0x69 is the control index
   519‚Üí              const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   520‚Üí              if (nextByte !== undefined && nextByte >= 0x28 && nextByte <= 0x3F) {
   521‚Üí                currentControlId = nextByte;
   522‚Üí                i++; // Skip the control ID byte
   523‚Üí              }
   524‚Üí            } else if (byte === 0x62 || byte === 0x68 || byte === 0x6A || byte === 0x6F) {
   525‚Üí              // These seem to be followed by control index
   526‚Üí              const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   527‚Üí              if (nextByte !== undefined && nextByte >= 0x30 && nextByte <= 0x3F) {
   528‚Üí                currentControlId = nextByte;
   529‚Üí                i++; // Skip the control ID byte
   530‚Üí              }
   531‚Üí            } else if (byte === 0x60) {
   532‚Üí              // 0x60 followed by control ID
   533‚Üí              const nextByte = data[i + 1];
   534‚Üí              if (nextByte !== undefined && (nextByte >= 0x28 && nextByte <= 0x3F)) {
   535‚Üí                currentControlId = nextByte;
   536‚Üí                i++; // Skip the control ID byte
   537‚Üí              }
   538‚Üí            }
   539‚Üí            currentName = '';
   540‚Üí          } else if (byte !== undefined && byte >= 32 && byte <= 126) {
   541‚Üí            // ASCII printable character - part of name
   542‚Üí            currentName += String.fromCharCode(byte);
   543‚Üí          } else if (currentName.length > 0 && (byte === 0x60 || byte === 0x00 || byte === 0xF7)) {
   544‚Üí            // End of current name
   545‚Üí            if (currentControlId >= 0 && currentName.length > 0) {
   546‚Üí              controlNames.set(currentControlId, currentName.trim());
   547‚Üí              currentName = '';
   548‚Üí            }
   549‚Üí          }
   550‚Üí        }
   551‚Üí
   552‚Üí        // Save last name if exists
   553‚Üí        if (currentControlId >= 0 && currentName.length > 0) {
   554‚Üí          controlNames.set(currentControlId, currentName.trim());
   555‚Üí        }
   556‚Üí
   557‚Üí        // Apply names to controls
   558‚Üí        for (const control of controls) {
   559‚Üí          if (control.controlId !== undefined) {
   560‚Üí            const name = controlNames.get(control.controlId);
   561‚Üí            if (name) {
   562‚Üí              control.name = name;
   563‚Üí            }
   564‚Üí          }
   565‚Üí        }
   566‚Üí      }
   567‚Üí    }
   568‚Üí
   569‚Üí    const result: { controls: ControlMapping[]; colors: ColorMapping[]; name?: string } = {
   570‚Üí      controls,
   571‚Üí      colors
   572‚Üí    };
   573‚Üí
   574‚Üí    if (modeName !== undefined) {
   575‚Üí      result.name = modeName;
   576‚Üí    }
   577‚Üí
   578‚Üí    return result;
   579‚Üí  }
